channel.title: Application Repository on
channel.description: Recent content in Application Repository on

item.title: Add Application Repository
item.description:
This section introduces how to add an application repository in the workspace.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a workspace and have the App Repos Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

  • The Helm Chart repository has been created in advance. For information on how to create a Helm Chart repository, please refer to the Helm Documentation.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the App Repos Management permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click App Management > App Repositories in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Create on the page.

  4. In the Add App Repository dialog, configure the parameters for the application repository, and then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Name

item.title: View Application Repository List
item.description:
This section explains how to view the list of application repositories.

Prerequisites

You should join a workspace and have the App Repos Viewing permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the App Repos Viewing permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click App Management > App Repositories in the left navigation pane.

    • Application repository list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: Edit Application Repository
item.description:
This section explains how to edit an application repository.

Prerequisites

You should join a workspace and have the App Repos Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the App Repos Management permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click App Management > App Repositories in the left navigation pane.

    • Click on the right side of the application repository you want to edit, then select Edit Information from the drop-down list.

    • In the Edit App Repository dialog, configure the parameters for the application repository, then click OK.

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: Delete Application Repository
item.description:
This section explains how to delete an application repository.

Warning

After deleting an application repository, users will not be able to install applications from the repository. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

You should join a workspace and have the App Repos Management permission within the workspace. For more information, refer to "Workspace Members" and "Workspace Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the App Repos Management permission, and access your workspace.

  2. Click App Management > App Repositories in the left navigation pane.

    • Click on the right side of the application repository you want to delete, then select Delete from the drop-down list.

    • In the Delete App Repository dialog, enter the name of the application repository, then click OK.
